Package gw.api.geocode

Class AbstractGeocodePlugin

java.lang.Object
gw.api.plugin.StartablePluginBase
gw.api.geocode.AbstractGeocodePlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
InternalPlugin, IStartablePlugin, GeocodePlugin, Remote
public abstract class AbstractGeocodePlugin extends StartablePluginBase implements GeocodePlugin

  • Method Details

    • getPluginName

      public String getPluginName()
      Overrides:
      getPluginName in class StartablePluginBase

    • geocodeAddressBestMatch

      public Address geocodeAddressBestMatch(Address address) throws RemoteException
      Synchronously geocode an Address. There is no useful default way to handle this, and it is the ONE mandatory piece of a customer-provided Geocoding plugin.
      Specified by:
      geocodeAddressBestMatch in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. If successfully geocodeable, this address will be modified in-place to include the best match for Latitude and Longitude and set to a successful geocode status. If not, it should be set to the failure GeocodeStatus. If a network or transient error occurs, the address should not be modified and an exception should be thrown.
      Returns:
      An address. This should either be the original Address object, or a new Address object containing the best corrected match found by the Geocoding service.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • _geocodeAddressBestMatch

      protected abstract Address _geocodeAddressBestMatch(Address address) throws RemoteException
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • geocodeAddressWithCorrections

      public List<Address> geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address) throws RemoteException
      By default, we simply call geocodeAddressWithCorrections(address,-1) to ignore maxResults.
      Specified by:
      geocodeAddressWithCorrections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. This address must not be modified by the method.
      Returns:
      A list of addresses. If the geocoding service supports multiple corrections, the first result returned should be the best match available, and should match the Latitude and Longitude set on the original If the geocoding service does not support multiple corrections, this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this default behavior.)
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • geocodeAddressWithCorrections

      public List<Address> geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address, int maxResults) throws RemoteException
      By default, we simply "wrap" geocodeAddressBestMatch(). By default we ignore maxResults.
      Specified by:
      geocodeAddressWithCorrections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. This address must not be modified by the method.
      maxResults - the maximum number of results to return, if a positive/non-zero integer. Returns all results if zero or negative.
      Returns:
      A list of addresses. If the geocoding service supports multiple corrections, the first result returned should be the best match available, and should match the Latitude and Longitude set on the original If the geocoding service does not support multiple corrections, this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this behavior.)
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • getMapForAddress

      public MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address, UnitOfDistance unit) throws RemoteException
      There is no practical "generic" way to generate maps. Plugins must override this method if they support Mapping.
      Specified by:
      getMapForAddress in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address -
      unit -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • getMapForAddress

      public MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address, UnitOfDistance unit, String options) throws RemoteException
      By default, this simply drops the options string and calls the base getMapForAddress() method. Note that there is no practical "generic" way to generate maps. Plugins must override the base getMapForAddress() method if they support Mapping.

      Note that "options" is an opaque string; this is only useful if passed to a KNOWN plugin implementation. Plugins should ignore unknown options.

      Specified by:
      getMapForAddress in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address -
      unit -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • getDrivingDirections

      public DrivingDirections getDrivingDirections(Address startAddress, Address finishAddress, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance) throws RemoteException
      There is no practical "generic" way to provide driving directions. Plugins must override this method if they support directions.
      Specified by:
      getDrivingDirections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      startAddress - The start address
      finishAddress - The finish address
      unitOfDistance - a unit of distance object indicating whether the directions should be in Metric or US/Imperial units.
      Returns:
      a DrivingDirections object, or null if directions are not supported.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is an error accessing the external data source.

    • _getDrivingDirections

      protected abstract DrivingDirections _getDrivingDirections(Address startAddress, Address finishAddress, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance) throws RemoteException
      There is no practical "generic" way to provide driving directions. Plugins must override this method if they support directions.
      Throws:
      RemoteException

      protected AbstractGeocodePlugin.LatLong getLatLongFromAddress(Address address) throws RemoteException

      RemoteException

    • getAddressByGeocode

      public List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(BigDecimal latitude, BigDecimal longitude) throws RemoteException
      By default, we simply call getAddressByGeocode(latitude,longitude, -1).
      Specified by:
      getAddressByGeocode in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      latitude -
      longitude -
      Returns:
      A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this behavior.) If finding by geocode is not supported, this must return null.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • getAddressByGeocode

      public List<Address> getAddressByGeocode(BigDecimal latitude, BigDecimal longitude, int maxResults) throws RemoteException
      By default, we simply "wrap" getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(). By default we ignore maxResults.
      Specified by:
      getAddressByGeocode in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      latitude -
      longitude -
      maxResults - the maximum number of results to return, if a positive/non-zero integer. Returns all results if zero or negative.
      Returns:
      A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch

      public Address getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(BigDecimal latitude, BigDecimal longitude) throws RemoteException
      There is no practical "generic" way to find an address by Geocode and this is an optional operation. Plugins must override this method if they support Mapping.
      Specified by:
      getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      latitude -
      longitude -
      Returns:
      An address providing the best match available for the provided Latitude and Longitude, or null if either no match was found, or this is not supported, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.).
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if there is a problem connecting to the datasource.

    • pluginSupportsCorrections

      public boolean pluginSupportsCorrections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support corrections, so this defaults to returning false. Make sure to override this to return true if your plugin returns corrections and you want the application to log them.
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsCorrections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin returns a corrected address with geocodeAddressBestMatch; if it does not, it should return a copy of the provided address.

    • pluginSupportsDrivingDirections

      public boolean pluginSupportsDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsDrivingDirections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin supports calls to getDrivingDirections.

    • pluginSupportsMappingByAddress

      public boolean pluginSupportsMappingByAddress()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping, so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsMappingByAddress in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin supports calls to getMapForAddress (to get a non-route map)

    • pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections

      public boolean pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support findByGeocodeBestMatch(), so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin supports returning multiple corrected addresses when geocodeAddressWithCorrections; if false, the return type of geocodeAddressWithCorrections should be a singleton list containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch

    • pluginSupportsFindByGeocode

      public boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support findByGeocodeBestMatch(), so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsFindByGeocode in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin supports generating a best-match address from a given Latitude/Longitude pair.

    • pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple

      public boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple()
      By default, we wrap singleton returns, so we simple return the results of pluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
      Specified by:
      pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin supports generating a list of potential-match addresses from a given Latitude/Longitude pair.

    • pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections

      public boolean pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping with driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:

      public boolean pluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections()
      There is no practical "generic" way to support mapping with driving directions, so this defaults to returning false.
      Specified by:
      pluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections in interface GeocodePlugin
      Returns:
      true, if the plugin returns an overview map with the driving directions

    • isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode

      public boolean isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode(Address address)
      By default, this method checks if the address is sufficient to geocode without calling the service
      Specified by:
      isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode in interface GeocodePlugin
      Parameters:
      address - to verify is sufficient to geocode
      Returns:
      true if the address contains a non-empty postal code, city, state, and country

    • getStateByNameOrCode

      public State getStateByNameOrCode(String stateName)
      Provides a single method to try find a State by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation.)
      Parameters:
      stateName - a string indicating a state, either by abbreviation (typecode) or name.
      Returns:
      the state's typekey

    • getCountryTypeCodeByName

      public Country getCountryTypeCodeByName(String countryName)
      Provides a single method to try find a Country by name or typecode (OOTB corresponds ISO 2-letter abbreviation.) Has some limited "intelligence" for matching common short forms of country names.
      Parameters:
      countryName - a string indicating a country, either by abbreviation (typecode) or name.
      Returns:
      the country's typekey

      Returns:
      the string country name

    • start

      public void start(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler, boolean serverStarting)
      Called during server startup and from the UI. All callback operations should be wrapped by the execute() method of the given StartablePluginCallbackHandler.
      Specified by:
      start in interface IStartablePlugin
      Overrides:
      start in class StartablePluginBase
      Parameters:
      pluginCallbackHandler - Implementation of StartablePluginCallbackHandler that executes as the system user.
      serverStarting - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is starting; false if it comes from the UI
      Throws:
      Exception - To abort server startup
